{"step_by_step_thinking": "Microaerophilic organisms are those that require oxygen to survive, but at lower concentration than is present in the atmosphere. They can't survive in the normal oxygen concentration of 21% and also can't survive in the absence of oxygen. Campylobacter is a well-known microaerophilic bacterium. Vibrio, Bacteroides, and Pseudomonas are not microaerophilic.", "answer_choice": "A"}
